column4: [IBM laptop T42] /proc/acpi/processor/CPU/power shows "state C1 usage: 082, state C2 usage 080592, state C3 usage 0141842." Room temperature is 27.5°C. Still the fan does not extinguish. Is this normal?
what's the CPU temp?
Hardware Sensors Monitor lists 8 different temperatures. Which one should I pick?
Is one labelled CPU, or core, or processor or something? (if not, just give me the highest)
They are not labelled. The highest is 54°C.
seems reasonable (that's not too hot)
I am curious if it is normal that the fan does not extinguish even though I do not touch the keyboard for a long time and web browser is not receiving animated Java scripts.
by extinguish, you mean turn off?
Yes, automatically turn off at low load.
try running 'top', is anything using the CPU?
%CPU gconf, Xorg, sensors-applet: all 0.7%. No more.
hmm
what CPU?
Intel pentium M processor at 1.7 GHz.
can you do a 'cat /sys/devices/system/cpu/cpu0/cpufreq/scaling_governor' ?
scaling governor is 'ondemand'.
can you cat the scaling_available_frequencies in the same directories?
scaling_available_frequencies: 1,7 1.4 1.2 1.0 0.8 0.6 GHz.
try forcing your CPU to run at it's minimum speed, see if it cools down and the fans turn off
take the lowest available frequency value, and write it to scaling_max_freq. e.g. "echo 600000 > scaling_max_freq"

My time is running out. I will try to follow your recipe " take the lowest available frequency value, and write it to scaling_max_freq. e.g. "echo 600000 > scaling_max_freq"" later. --  Thank you very much for your help.
a problem that feeds you text a page at a time (pager) i.e. more/less
a file pager is no problem.
